title: Tylenol, Autism and Vaccines: What to Know After Trump’s Announcement
summary: For decades, researchers have looked for links. Most believe the disorder springs from a complex interplay of genetics and environmental factors.

title: Kenvue, the Company Behind Tylenol, Tries to Navigate Its Latest Crisis
summary: Kenvue, a two-year-old spinoff from Johnson & Johnson, is confronting a public-relations nightmare as President Trump and others suggest unproven links between the pain reliever and autism.

title: F.D.A. to Relabel Leucovorin for Autism Treatment
summary: The F.D.A. announced Monday that it would change the drug’s label to reflect potential benefits in reducing autism symptoms.

title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Show to Return to ABC on Tuesday Night
summary: The network’s removal of Mr. Kimmel’s show last week almost immediately morphed into a flashpoint for free speech in America.

title: Politicians and Celebrities Weigh In on Jimmy Kimmel’s Return to Late Night
summary: Some celebrated ABC’s decision to rescind the show’s suspension, while others criticized it.

title: Jimmy Kimmel to Return to Air After Suspension Over Kirk Remarks: What to Know
summary: The late-night show will return to the air on Tuesday, nearly a week after ABC suspended it in response to Mr. Kimmel’s remarks about the shooting of Charlie Kirk.

title: ‘The View’ Hosts Criticize Trump Administration Over Kimmel
summary: The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission has suggested that the daytime talk show should could also come under government scrutiny.

title: Supreme Court Allows Trump to Fire F.T.C. Commissioner
summary: The justices said they will consider whether to overrule a landmark Supreme Court precedent that has limited the president’s ability to fire top officials at the agency.

title: Trump’s Tax Cut Is Underwater. Can a ‘Refund Boom’ Save It?
summary: Republicans are hoping a new name, along with larger refunds for many Americans next year, can buoy an economic agenda that polls show is unpopular.

title: Halligan, Trump’s Chosen Prosecutor, Takes Over Comey and James Cases
summary: The president is pushing up against the statute of limitations in his pursuit of charges against a former F.B.I. director, and also wants the attorney general of New York and a California senator prosecuted.

title: Trump’s Pick to Replace Ousted U.S. Attorney Lacks Prosecutorial Experience
summary: Lindsey Halligan worked as a personal lawyer for President Trump and then led the effort to scrutinize the Smithsonian for “improper ideology.”

title: Trump’s Efforts to Punish His Enemies Are Ramping Up
summary: Some rank-and-file prosecutors are growing alarmed about pressure to bring indictments even when evidence is weak.

title: The Wary, Warming, Wildly Consequential Alliance of Ocasio-Cortez and Mamdani
summary: She was the ‘big sister’ he hoped to impress. He seemed inexperienced to her. Now, they’re the faces of a political movement — and New York is its test case.

title: World Leaders Recognize Palestinian State, in a Challenge to U.S. and Israel
summary: At a meeting ahead of the U.N. General Assembly, France and other U.S. allies made official a breach with Washington that has been years in the making.

title: Palestinian Statehood Seems More Remote Than Ever
summary: Even before the war in Gaza, negotiations failed to produce peace between the Israelis and the Palestinians.

title: Trump’s H-1B Visa Fee Knocks Down Bridge Between India and the U.S.
summary: The H-1B visa lured a generation of Indian professionals to take part in the American dream. A $100,000 fee has forced a rethink of the route.

title: When ICE Shows Up at a Factory, What Can a Governor Do?
summary: “I’m used to being able to solve problems,” Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York said as she visited a factory where immigration officials arrested 57 people.

title: Harris-Biden Rift Outlined in ’107 Days’ Reflects Long Pattern of History
summary: Many presidents and vice presidents fall out by the end of their tenures, a fraught dynamic that goes back to the early days of the republic.

title: Nvidia to Invest $100 Billion in OpenAI
summary: The chipmaker’s investment in the San Francisco start-up is an indication of the wild financial figures being tossed around in the world of artificial intelligence.

title: U.S. Asks Judge to Break Up Google’s Advertising Technology Monopoly
summary: The Justice Department argued that the best way to address the company’s unfair advantage was to force it to sell off portions of its business.

title: Earthquake Jolts Bay Area Residents Awake
summary: A 4.3-magnitude earthquake was strong enough to rattle nerves in the middle of the night, especially in the heavily populated East Bay where it was centered.

title: Greenlandic Woman Wins Her Baby Back in Denmark
summary: A young Greenlandic woman living in Denmark will regain custody of the infant girl taken from her shortly after birth. The case has become the latest flashpoint between Denmark and Greenland.

title: High Holiday Reflections on the State of American Jews
summary: “I never would have imagined the splinters inside of the Jewish community,” said Rabbi Elan Babchuck, whose work includes research on polarization.

title: For Zohran Mamdani, Judaism’s Holiest Days Present a Test
summary: Mr. Mamdani intends to appear at explicitly Jewish spaces during the High Holy Days, seeking to bridge a divide with some Jewish voters as he runs for mayor.

title: Review: ‘Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay’ at the Met
summary: The Metropolitan Opera opened its season with a superficial adaptation of Michael Chabon’s novel “The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay.”

title: President Trump Eulogizes Charlie Kirk
summary: Trump’s first presidential eulogy made no effort to unite the country, which is the traditional goal of a presidential eulogy.

title: What the Government Autism Announcement Got So Wrong
summary: The Trump administration misunderstands autism and what autistic people and our families need.

title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Show Is Coming Back
summary: Also, Palestinian statehood took center stage at the U.N. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Retired Lobbyist in Federal Custody in ABC Affiliate Shooting in Sacramento, California
summary: Prosecutors say that the suspect, a 64-year-old Sacramento man, had a note critical of Trump administration officials and a separate calendar reminder to “Do the Next Scary Thing.”

title: North Carolina Republicans Unveil Broad Crime Bill After Stabbing
summary: The state measure would keep more defendants in jail before trial and increase oversight of judicial officials. But it is unclear if it would have made a difference in the August attack.

title: Tiger Handler Linked to Joe Exotic Is Fatally Mauled by Tiger
summary: Ryan Easley, 37, was performing at his family-run private zoo in Hugo, Okla., when a tiger attacked him, the authorities said. He was pronounced dead at the scene.

title: Tech Executive Dies After Falling 2,000 Feet on Mount Shasta
summary: While the Argentine hiker and entrepreneur, Matias Augusto Travizano, was descending the mountain, he fell down a glacier, the authorities said.
